metadata.title: CVE-2019-11701 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The default webcal: protocol handler will load a web site vulnerable tocross-site scripting (XSS) attacks. This default was left in place as alegacy feature and has now been removed. *Note: this issue only affectsusers with an account on the vulnerable service. Other users areunaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 67.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11701` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
